prompts:
are these valid issues that actually need fixing? if so fix them: 
• - Blocking – script timeout still non-portable (engine/script-
    interpreter.sh:24-41): we still shell out to timeout, which isn’t available
    in the default macOS/Claude environment. Any script phase instantly fails
    with “command not found”. Please guard the call (or switch to a Node-level
    timeout) before moving forward.
  - Blocking – phase object is still {} (engine/script-interpreter.sh:50-59): the
    wrapper continues to define const phase = context.phases.current ? {} : {};,
    so adaptive/gap-check scripts never receive phase metadata (phase.id, etc.).
    That breaks every spec example that branches on phase attributes.
  - Blocking – deliverable paths keep {{output_dir}} literals (engine/
    subagent-pool.sh:138-168): templated output paths aren’t run through
    substitute_template_vars. The engine creates directories literally named
    {{output_dir}}, which means later phases/gap checks can’t find their outputs.
  - Bug – prompt rendering still sees fabricated phase data (engine/subagent-
    pool.sh:149-154): we’re injecting a stub {id,name,description} instead of
    the real phase JSON, so workflow-specific prompt templates can’t access their
    descriptions or behaviors.
  - Bug – finalize_workflow references undefined workflow_path (engine/workflow-
    runner.sh:268-281): within the helper the variable is out of scope, causing
    template resolution to fail whenever the template isn’t already absolute.
  - Bug – metadata duration uses BSD-only date -j (engine/workflow-runner.sh:309-
    320): on Linux this flag isn’t recognized, so duration calculation fails.
    Needs a cross-platform approach.
rerun the tests we've previously created and @skills/use-workflows/IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN_V3.md . what's next to do ?
get the tests fully working through fixing issues with our implementation or if its not an issue with implementation then u can fix the test

1. Update the remaining unit tests (template, script, context) to reflect the
     new context schema and script runner—then make sure they pass.
  2. Align the integration test with the current runner semantics (context lives
     in .temp/<feature>/context.json; metadata path is known).
  3. Restore true parallelism once we have a locking strategy for context.json,
     or explicitly scope Phase 1’s “parallel” requirement to serialized MVP
     behavior.
  4. Wire the runner’s CLI to accept flags cleanly (rename the current “flags”
     array to actual options, avoid treating arbitrary strings as flags).
  5. Track the outstanding “auto-continue” stubs for checkpoints/gap escalations
     so we don’t forget to replace them when introducing real user prompts.
